meanings.definition: Feeling or showing suspicion or distrust
meanings.sent1: The man gave a leerier look to the stranger standing outside his house.
meanings.sent2: She felt leerier than usual when walking alone in the dark alley.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a leerier stare at the new dog in the house, unsure of its intentions.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a leerier atmosphere as the night grew darker.
meanings.sent5: The creaking sound from the attic made the house feel even leerier than before.

meanings.sent1: The abandoned building had a leerier appearance as the sun set.
meanings.sent2: The strange noise coming from the basement made the situation even leerier.
meanings.sent3: The leerier feeling in the air made her check the locks on the doors multiple times.
meanings.sent4: The leerier shadows cast by the flickering streetlight added to the eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The leerier behavior of the new neighbor raised concerns among the residents.
